p: Plants are long been used as a source of medicine by human beings. However, the compound(s) responsible for their therapeutic activities remained unknown for centuries. At the end of 19th century a shift occurred from natural to synthetic drugs, and phytomedicine has since progressively fallen out of use [ 1]. Though synthetic medicines are in use all over the world, some ancient medicinal systems still persist, e.g., Unani Tibb, Ayurveda, and traditional Chinese medicine. They make ample use of medicinal plants, which provide a source to identify chemical compounds and use them to treat different ailments [ 2].
